Hello

As discussed with Jamie yesterday, we are looking in good shape for our testing tomorrow. I just wanted to flag a number of things as priorities to look at today if possible, please! Mostly there are 

1. Specialist group application form - please can you change the field label 'Early registration code' to 'Password'
2. Specialist group application form - please can you change the button text from 'Go to early registration' to read 'Go to application form'
3. Specialist group application form - please can you amend "The symbol * denotes required fields." to read "Fields marked with an asterisk * must be completed."
4. Landing page - this is hard coded so please can you change the text "Welcome to the volunteer section of the London 2012 Olympics website" to "Welcome to the Games Maker section of the London 2012 website."
5. Access Games Maker - can you change the text at the top of this form to read "Welcome to >access Games Maker, our ground breaking project which ensures disabled people can join in as a London 2012 Games Maker."
6. Access Games Maker - can you change the button text to read "Submit to >access Games Maker" or if that's too long "Submit your form"
7. The promo boxes on the 'About Volunteering hub' pages seem to have disappeared altogether from the page in edit mode - I also need to be able to create links from the promo titles, which was not possible previously.

Hi Morag,

1-6 done / updated,

> promo boxes on the 'About Volunteering hub' pages 

Do you mean Are you eligible / Volunteering timeline ? They seem to be showing here, are you still not seeing them?

Still looking at why there not linkable.

Jamie

Hi Morag,

I think I have fixed the links, seems to work better if you just link to the page and then edit the text rather than linking existing text (or it may just be that you need to clear the old text first *)

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/volunteer/about-volunteering/index.php

* I changed the type of the container which is why the need to clear it first.
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

comments.value:
Hi

I've noticed that a few of the Sports pages are missing their linked venues, i think it may be because venues have been renamed. They are Gymnastic (Artistic & Trampoline) which should have North Greenwich Arena (previously north Greenwich arena 1) and Cycling - Mountain Biking, which should have Hadleigh Farm. The sports pages all appear to be tagged with the correct venue but they aren't displaying. Is they a way we can fix this here??

Thanks

Trailblazer Volunteer  - Editorial Services
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
London, E14 5LN
Switchboard +44 (0)203 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)203 2012 492
www.london2012.com
Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com
Please think before you print this email




[cid:image001.jpg@01CB08A1.0BE49E00]

Hi Lianne,

I think the venue just needed updating under the meta data (see attached) which I have just done for the relevant pages.

Jamie
Thanks, the north Greenwich one works ok but i can’t see the hadleigh farm one appearing, i had put hadleigh farm into the meta data but it’s still not appeared?

On 10 Jun 2010, at 13:56, Lianne Warnell wrote:

> Cycling - Mountain Biking,

Hi Lianne,

Do you mean in blue at the top? It's showing for me, have you tried holding down alt while clicking reload?
No sorry, i meant in the top right hand side. The other pages have a box with the venue picture and a bit of info about them that links through to the venue page

Hi Lianne,

Found the problem in the end, the page name was 'Hadleigh farm' but the page was called 'Hadleigh Farm, Essex'

But to confuse matters if you used 'Hadleigh farm, Essex' it thought you we're tagging it to /two/ venue i) Hadleigh Farm and ii) Essex (due ot the comma)

Anyway good news is I added a workaround and it's working now..
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/cycling-mountain-bike.php

Jamie

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/cycling-mountain-bike.php

Excellent, thanks very much for sorting this out

Lianne

Sorry me again, i just updated the paralympic archery page as The Royal Artillery Barracks wasn’t showing and it’s updated the page to show hadleigh farm


[cid:image001.jpg@01CB08B5.0B89BCB0]

Hi Lianne,

Should be fixed now..
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/paralympic/paralympic-archery.php

comments.value:
Hello

I have now started inputting content into the templates and am spotting some things to fix:

Did you know? box on all templates - doesn't allow you to input content 

All templates - we are no longer going to have any supporting partners in the footer so please could you remove the footer banner from all templates? Please leave the pink chopstick in though

There is an odd keyline appearing around the Facebook group module - can you remove this altogether?

Other volunteering opportunities module - needs to link to the page on 'Other ways to get involved'

Sign in and  Apply now boxes top right - the font seems very large. Also, these boxes should not be visible at this stage - we are going to launch without them. Can you suppress them for now?

About volunteering hub page - the body copy font is too large on this page - it should be the same as on the other pages.

Did you know? box on all templates - doesn't allow you to input content
>> it's working now ( I've tested it in ie8 )

All templates - we are no longer going to have any supporting partners in the footer so please could you remove the footer banner from all templates? Please leave the pink chopstick in though
>> removed them and left the chopstick

There is an odd keyline appearing around the Facebook group module - can you remove this altogether?
>> Its an iframe coming from facebook, unfortunately we cannot change the border without trickery, will recheck with Janos

Other volunteering opportunities module - needs to link to the page on 'Other ways to get involved'
>> There's 2 pages in there and, i picked one, it now links to get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-get-involved/volunteering-in-your-area.php, let me know in case this is the wrong one please!

Sign in and Apply now boxes top right - the font seems very large. Also, these boxes should not be visible at this stage - we are going to launch without them. Can you suppress them for now?
>> Made the font smaller and hid them for now

About volunteering hub page - the body copy font is too large on this page - it should be the same as on the other pages. 
>> Sorted

Following my conversation with Jamie:

The 'Access Now' page with form should be called 'Access Games Maker' please. I think you will need to change this or I will break it....

The 'Early registration' form and button should be called 'Specialist group application'

It would be really fantastic if you could add in the 'Vision impairment' checkbox to the 'Early registration' form in time for Weds as discussed. People who check the checkbox would go to the 'Access now' form while anyone who didn't check it now would go to the ATOS form. The wording against the 'Vision impairment' checkbox would be 'Please check this box if you use screen reader technology'.

Thanks!

A few more tweaks please!

On the Volunteering About hub template, the link boxes in the two promos don't seem to work. I keep trying to add links (in FF3) but no link is created.

Also on the Volunteering About hub, the left hand promo pic (Are you eligible?) is rendering oddly for some reason I can't figure out.

Access now form - in addition to changing the name of this page to 'Access Games Maker' as discussed last week, please can you change the reference to 'access now' in the text "Welcome to >access now, our ground breaking project which ensures disabled people can join in as a London 2012 Games Maker."

The font size of the body copy on the Volunteering About hub template is still too large

On the Roles pages, I want to create some anchor links so you can jump down the page to the relevant section. I don't think this is working in the CMS - can you advise the best way to create them?

The Volunteering section is missing the Home page in the left hand nav - what is the best way to make this appear?

The known bug with ordering of promo boxes is occuring on the page called 'Roles' - this has 10 promos which should appear in alphabetical order. I did input them in alpha order, but now they are appearing randomly - is it possible to investigate this?

The Did you know? box is too shallow for the text we need to put into it - please can you make it deeper / without a finite depth?

Landing page - the promos need linking up to the correct pages but the page is not editable - is it possible to make it editable, or to hard code in some changes?

- missing Homepage - i reckon this is hidden because we ticked 'hide from navigation' on the homepage to hide it.

- promo boxes, this is being investigated by janos, i will check with him...

- did you know - will do this today

- landing page -  it will best to hard-code them, please let me know where the links link to and i will do so

Thanks, Lars.

A couple more things - the 'Apply now' and 'Visit the portal' boxes are still showing in the top right even though - is it possible to remove these?

Landing page - please can you hardcode these links:
Have you got what it takes - please link to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/have-you-got-what-it-takes/index.php 
The realities of volunteering - please change this to Being a Games Maker and link it to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/about-volunteering/being-a-games-maker.php
Enter the site - should take you to Volunteering home
Could you update the 'Latest' box to read 'Latest: We are currently accepting specialist applications only. Applications for generalist roles start in September.'
'Apply now' and 'Visit the portal'  are removed but i didn't republish all pages... do you want me to? You can see them gone one preview...
Morag, i did all of those things... will do a publish now
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

From: Alastair Taylor [alastair@synthetix.com]
Sent: 10 June 2010 09:41
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: FW: ask.london2012.com issue

Hi Liz,

We have spotted a small problem with the way the smartAgent is launched from your website. I gather this is due to the code used to pop it up.

If you see the email below it explains the problem and how to solve it.

I hope this is OK and if you need anyone to talk it through please let me know.

Kind regards

Alastair

-----Original Message-----
From: Peter McKean [mailto:peter@synthetix.com]
Sent: 09 June 2010 18:31
To: Alastair Taylor
Cc: alan@synthetix.com
Subject: ask.london2012.com issue

Alastair,

I'm seeing an issue with ask.london2012.com related to the frameset that LOCOG have put in place to direct the popup window to http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/.

Using the agent normally can cause horizontal and vertical scrollbars to appear on the screen, obscuring part of the interface.

To stop this, LOCOG need to replace this code on their server:

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>ask.london2012.com</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<FRAMESET ROWS="*,0">
<FRAME SRC="http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/" NORESIZE>
<NOFRAMES>
Your browser does not support frames.
</NOFRAMES>
</FRAMESET>
</HTML>

...with...

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>ask.london2012.com</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<FRAMESET ROWS="*,0" FRAMEBORDER="0" BORDER="0" FRAMESPACING="0">
<FRAME SRC="http://london2012.smartagent.co.uk/" NORESIZE SCROLLING="NO">
<NOFRAMES>
Your browser does not support frames.
</NOFRAMES>
</FRAMESET>
</HTML>

I've tested this on our systems and it works fine.

Peter.
Hi Liz, We don't host ask.london2012.com ? We just pop a window open to it Ask a question Jamie

Hm, Valid point. You can tell I'm in the midst of a massive email overload. I'll follow up with them!
________________________________________
Marking as solved

comments.value: [see recent email correspondence - danny]

Hi Jag,

Please find attached a diagram (attached) illustrating how I saw the new staging servers fitting in (btw. I have no strong preference to them being used this way, this just what I sort of expected based on previous emails)

I realise that one of the main criteria you are hoping to use it for is testing of the load balancers and Apache configs (which will be immensely useful) and therefore you possibly weren't seeing them as part of the live (everyday) publication workflow, maybe you were? once again happy to use them either way.

Obviously if we have a static / self contained website it is very easy to just place it on the staging servers, see if it works and then copy it across to the live servers if it does.

However when we have a new section of the main site (like /get-involved/volunteering) that is intrinsically tied to other pages on the main site / shares components with the live CMS and utilises feeds running on the live CMS it is not quite so simple to separate out the site to a separate server.

The approach I have outlined in the diagram below (and in my email last week) re-routes the current publication from "CMS to web01" to "CMS to staging server01" this gives us an opportunity to limit the RSYNC (completely, by file type or by section) between the staging environment and web01 and therefore view the site on the staging servers first.

The downside of this approach is that staging 01 and 02 become part of the publication workflow and therefore if they are unavailable publication will break.

A complete shutdown of the rsync will also hold up everyday editorial publication, therefore I suggest we look at an intelligent way of limiting what is automatically rynced and what has to be pushed by hand.

I think we probably also need to decide which of these the new servers is really (or most importantly) for:

- testing out config changes to Apache and/or the load balancer and Akamai
- testing out standalone new sites
- a real time mirror of the live environment that all changes have first to pass though (question around delays to editorial publication and how we deal with these)
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment of certain kinds of global files (css / js etc.)
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment of certain sections
- limiting the automatic syncing to the live environment  completely in the case of a relaunch (question around delays to editorial publication and how we deal with these)

The one big question that needs clarifying I think is whether we expect these servers to be part of the live everyday production workflow (if they are, we can't just turn them off / reboot them at will) or do they simply hold a 'clone' of the existing published site (ie. whatever is on web01 although that does imply they are only useful for testing config changes and not 'staging').

I have included on the diagram our existing / internal dev/staging environment for completeness, what is important to note here is that the editorial content on this server is not the same as the live content, it is a periodic clone of the content held in the CMS, which makes it useful for development/testing but not for handling a real time staging->production workflow. 

Jamie

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator.

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!
